column3: huh. I run valgrind all the time on bitcoind... but I haven't on qt. Good finds! Reviewing...\n

> huh. I run valgrind all the time on bitcoind... but I haven't on qt. Good finds! Reviewing...\n\nYes, bitcoind was clean in asan too. Nice accomplishment. The GUI apparently has quite some leaks, some of which we probably can't help. None extremely serious - these are mostly objects allocated only once, although the thread leak is a bit scary for other reasons: there really shouldn't be a RPC

Tested ACK 4b2c2888868cb49806cd734ea36e7f5b032c3b00.
Looks much better now on OSX but still got some leaks reported (maybe OSX specific, maybe root source lies in Qt).

* `void PaymentServer::LoadRootCAs(X509_STORE* _store);`
* `CDBEnvOpen` via `CWallet::Verify()` and `CWallet::LoadWallet()`

![bildschirmfoto 2016-11-21 um 14 52 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/204
Huh, the leaks in `PaymentServer::LoadRootCAs` should have been solved with commit 4b2c2888868cb49806cd734ea36e7f5b032c3b00 . In any case I'm not claiming to plug all leaks, just most of them.

@jonasschnelli Which version of Qt are you testing with?

I'm currently testing with Qt5.7, on OS X 10.12.1, seeing similar results. Screenshots below.
![bitcoin-leaks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863730/20512851/26bb37d6-b0bd-11e6-8446-bb8244ec8517.png)
Payment Server:
![payment server](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863730/20512882/5e5b89d4-b0bd-11e6-80e9-367

@paveljanik Thanks! Verified that those don't get deleted (they likely didn't show up in my overview because I didn't check opening sub-windows apart from the debug window), so changed them too and re-pushed.\n
